meanings.definition: a position giving a strategic advantage
meanings.sent1: From this vantage, we can see the entire battlefield clearly.
meanings.sent2: She quickly climbed to a higher vantage to scout the area.
meanings.sent3: Standing on a tall vantage point, the cat thought it ruled the world.
meanings.sent4: The vantage of being on the hill allowed them to plan their next move.
meanings.sent5: The vantage of having a bird's eye view was invaluable in the mission.

meanings.sent1: Being in a vantage made it easier to negotiate a good deal.
meanings.sent2: The team secured a vantage for the upcoming competition.
meanings.sent3: Finding a shady vantage spot, they enjoyed a picnic in peace.
meanings.sent4: Her cozy vantage by the fireplace was perfect for reading.
meanings.sent5: The vantage of having a window seat on the plane was delightful.

meanings.definition: a point of view or perspective
meanings.sent1: From his vantage, the situation seemed much clearer.
meanings.sent2: She tried to understand his vantage on the matter.
meanings.sent3: The cat's vantage from the top shelf made everything look small.
meanings.sent4: His vantage as a teacher allowed him to guide his students effectively.
meanings.sent5: The vantage of being a parent gave her a new outlook on life.
